elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: As a pair, take a close look at your own budget with the aim of saving CHF 50/month on the purchase of a durable consumer good or a short trip. Advise each other on how you could save costs in the short and long term. Use the terms fixed and variable costs. Write down your most important findings.

elements.name: Frage 1
elements.title: Short-term savings opportunities:
elements.correctAnswer:
I could save on variable costs in the following areas:
1. Clothes, shoes: Buy fewer brand-name items, compare prices, buy less in general, avoid impulse purchases, use exchange markets or second-hand offers, ...
2. Body care, hairdresser: Buy cheaper products, look out for promotions, compare offers, ...
3. Cell phone: Do not exceed data limit (additional costs), do not play paid games, reduce online purchases, ...
4. Food: Buy fewer ready-made products, cook for yourself, ...
5. Eating out: Cook your own food and take it with you.
6. Hobbies: Use free sports facilities at school, exercise outside, compare offers, ...
7. Going out: Only take as much money with you as you want to spend, partying outside clubs and buying alcohol from a wholesaler, ...

elements.name: Frage 2
elements.title: Long-term savings opportunities:
elements.correctAnswer:
I could save on fixed costs in the following areas:
1. Health insurance premiums (basic insurance): Compare offers and choose a cheaper option.
2. Rent: Adjust housing costs to the budget, look for a shared flat, ...
3. Interest payments/leasing fees: Don't sign any contracts that put an excessive strain on the budget, basically only buy things you can afford.
4. Travel costs: Use your bike more often, work out which offers put the least strain on your annual budget.
5. Cell phone subscription: Compare offers and take out a cheap subscription with an unlimited data limit if necessary.
6. Sports subscription: compare prices for subscriptions (gym and the like), take advantage of free offers from the school, do sports outdoors, ...
